document.title: Nursing Assistant (Acute and Long Term Care)

8093B0D47C904766B71D1FB0FDAD8D5E.description: Assist patients/residents to reach the optimum level of independence.

49BD9352CDA94E3991E1C3A8D7CF927D.description: Assist patient with specified restorative (rehabilitation) needs.

EE98257C707F437FBCB29622104BB31B.description: List the purposes of restorative (rehabilitation) program.

E4D9B560848E464396875D16B565F986.description: Assist with restorative (rehabilitative) activities. The student will be able to:

EDDBA3ABC1E3460296C5064A6308447B.description: Complete assignments accurately and in a timely manner.

EFF88DC26462421482402778127C6413.description: Perform supervised organizational functions, following the patient care plan. The student will be able to:

AD78E07CF17B4DCD9D9AC375439C37DE.description: Respond to patient and family emotional needs.

E0201BF1EA0F41DEAA0DE2A2ED5E8D98.description: Discuss family roles and their significance to health.

4877825B89FE4961AAF049274A8566C1.description: Provide biological, psychological, and social support. The student will be able to:

30081ED5C18B4468803AE5DDDBDA2E85.description: Collect specimen from patient in isolation.

48A0D0686DD74C0FAF8311ECFF9916A3.description: Follow isolation procedure with food tray, PPE, and other supplies/equipment.

B1DFC8286FD84528B32EB316D1086BB0.description:
Apply the proper use of personal protective equipment (PPE) for all types of isolation including donning and removing PPE
appropriately.

50B7569E64C040EEB6B3AB28788258A9.description:
Provide care for patients with infectious diseases applying the principles of "Standard Precautions" utilized with all patients as well
as special procedures required.

51192BBA99964CBD819F595B7270429A.description: Apply the principles of infection control specific to nursing assisting. The student will be able to:

B97686EE2BF1469485C4DB953C33583F.description: Demonstrate an understanding of end of life care, hospice and palliative care.

C11BA34EC4754330B1C3DADD7F7A5F02.description: Identify components of the grief process.

779FDE3F2956454AA5F3D27138F492CA.description: Identify the need for community resources and services available to the elderly and their caregiver.

0C451F3EFB6A4C5A9877D8C29948AEF0.description: Report concerns to the nurse and appropriate authorities related to drug use and abuse in the elderly patient.

9B433606C9874E148A6C1A5DEBBA175F.description: Demonstrate awareness of common behaviors in drug use and abuse in the elderly.

39A38C89BEA64246AE09A5AD176C2398.description:
Provide care for patients with special needs (e.g., impaired hearing, impaired vision, immobility, impaired body functions, cognitively
impaired (dementia)).

0156385A0A7D4EB18385135ABE59F7B4.description: Identify common alterations in elderly patient behavior.

BA1564C4542649E293FB73561108EACC.description: Provide and involve patients in diversional activities.

63F50CD664AB4E00857E222D45F6A26C.description: Recognize and respond appropriately to symptoms of common diseases, including dementia, depression/suicide and Alzheimers.

B6D74AD867404498BEB2FC5A16E6FDF7.description: Apply reality orientation techniques and validation therapy unless it is contraindicated by the patient diagnosis.

90E367E375B74535A0D4B91FAD1E1765.description: Distinguish between fact and fallacy about the aging process.

FA5803AC67FC43FDAC6D806864DF4FF7.description: Identify attitudes and living habits that promote positive mental and physical health for the elderly.

FD6762F5C5A946D4A98E52DABED26FCE.description: Describe general characteristics, particular needs, and age related changes of the elderly.

72B38E520E3D46FC87CDD1E81AD637C3.description: Identify and assist with safety principles as related to the elderly.

B60A0C1A59D4404E89FFCE0F68F54B56.description: Identify and assist with methods to prevent falls in the elderly.

299BE4B52FB044C687C37241A4D26C20.description: Identify and assist with methods and procedures to prevent pressure ulcers.

716FE86206774FD1BE0A49D382B32069.description: Provide care for geriatric patients. The student will be able to:

B67EF90E6F504057A2A7B7766607309F.description: Identify methods of maintaining fluid balance including encouraging and restricting fluids.

85536F458D4B4A538F99C2311AF3AE1F.description: Demonstrate knowledge of the need for thickened liquids and fluid consistency.

33C22D97283A4D53898FC8D6B636BD78.description: Identify and implement regional, cultural and religious food guidelines/preferences.

FF539E18C1464C35B189F2A3AF9FA0DA.description: Check patient's diet tray for accuracy.

2EDB7E96C20B4642A118F449C2CAAA38.description: Apply principles of nutrition. The student will be able to:

D407FE0E12FF44CFA1990FD1B68CBA6F.description: Provide care for eyeglasses, artificial eyes, and contact lens.

304514C10B1A4635B3DDD733494051C0.description: Provide cast care and/or pin care.

08A950C410E24325976E7F63BBF09A70.description: Obtain and record an apical pulse.

9B8E7C8C9F744100AE282D8726602F4F.description: Reinforce dressings under the supervision of the RN/LPN.

838057F5D1F3432AA9A6C78181DF1F11.description: Assist with pre-operative and post-operative patient care.

181561D78BCE433BB7A02C2C3F176592.description: Care for patient in skin and skeletal traction.

CB0025E974F145D89B4C8D0499A20A23.description: Assist the nurse with care of the patient with complex medical needs.

AEF26052418748EC9455CD06A7304041.description: Assist with the collection of a sputum specimen.

B0EF6F252A9C4448912FFC392A7DEAB8.description: Assist with ostomy care including emptying or changing ostomy bags that do not adhere to the skin.

F21C5A01604C4FC5AB426938506B0274.description: Monitor and provide urinary catheter care and drainage systems.

293982052C62487EB8AFCBE903EDD66B.description: Observe, record, and report patient's emesis.

DCC288717DCD4823A1A69CEDA0590556.description: Understand and demonstrate proper collection of routine, timed urine and clean catch urine specimens.

E5AAD22729C9426194DA3F151F29BA74.description: Apply anti-embolic hose and sequential compression devices.

7D4C1A6A835D46A28F4F751E3AF46628.description: Assist with the admission, transfer, and discharge of a patient and/or resident.

1045ADBA78644664835A93136B6CC8FB.description: Assist with the admission of a patient and/or resident.

40320556C66F495D873C0938BD2E8348.description: Demonstrate ability to accurately measure, record and report vital signs.

20614702E1024392BF525BB346B0BE4C.description: Perform patient care procedures. The student will be able to:

13F0EFBB47F640F2AE352024A8C5FBD7.description: Recognize abnormal signs and symptoms of common diseases and conditions when providing patient care.

C2C96A59310C41F8B8546F96F8DF8BA4.description: Describe the relationships of body systems when providing patient care.

9F6690FB350F45159AEA472B3D6F12FC.description: Assist patient with both donning and doffing prosthesis and brace.

1645992CE3C14A51B89340FE5396B697.description: Monitor and assist with the drainage of urostomy bags and colostomy bags.

5F96E68EA843407A90437D0B7A8208F9.description: Demonstrate application and use of a leg bag, leg strap and dignity bag.

3EDFE403217749E998ECCB9FC0B8C80E.description: Empty, measure and record urinary output and/or drainage.

E4B396CB16FB407C8E086BB1ABDE6C23.description: Assist and/ or provide perineal care.

660530334EFF483E85D745E75C786ECE.description: Assist with bowel and bladder training.

7A392E42193649D98FF654AAB4F71D04.description: Assist patient with use of bedpan (standard and fracture)

B8B4F4871E3A4493BAC75F36C77DBBA5.description: Assist patient with toileting using various types of restorative and rehabilitative equipment.

68369DF7A5C54C149E15C490C5646ABB.description: Assist with and/or administer oral hygiene including denture care.

8760C37ECF0E4B30B37C2C2F5C2E775A.description: Demonstrate how to groom patient, including hair, skin, foot, hand and nail care.

B871AF2AC5624E2BADED54FF89DE3717.description: Demonstrate the use of a safety and/or electric razor to shave the patient.

BCC00ED661EE461C89DCBC70F1CA5010.description: Assist patient with hair care utilizing sink, tub, shower, bed or shower cap.

4522F883291C41C68568C7B98EC0312F.description: Administer back rub with bath and as needed.

AE24DE7E7FB44DC4BBE263C08C93EF87.description: Assist with shower or tub bath, including the use of specialty tubs or prepackaged disposable-bagged bath.

B07DFFC017954A908B2D9125FE75EF3F.description: Perform bed bath; observe and report changes in a patient including skin and level of consciousness.

9EA150D0F21A48DAAFF3A0994E49BA11.description: Provide personal patient care. The student will be able to:

DBCFC660AD6D4B749AE5BCE08328A43B.description: Describe emergency procedures utilized in the clinical area(s) and the role of the nursing assistant in these procedures.

6497D70D633548A58996DAC72A55E704.description: Assist patient with care and use of prosthetic/orthotic devices.

4F36C966E7FE4F5396F05D07350B541F.description: Apply supportive devices as directed (e.g., footboard, over-bed cradle, alternating pressure mattress).

BDF91985F4C9405C92C190BD437A1A12.description: Demonstrate the proper wheelchair safety techniques and assist patient as needed with use.

F8595E1ED91C47D7839D913CD60D1ECE.description: Assist patient in ambulation, including the use of crutch, cane, or walker.

2A2A4F1450874EEA8EA3E9F4E2510DB9.description: Demonstrate the proper use of a gait/transfer belt in both transfer and ambulation.

AF5C76EA13F7438BB83590303C3026CC.description:
Demonstrate lifting, supporting and transferring patients from bed to chair, bed to bed, and bed to stretcher, including the use of the
various assistive devices and equipment while utilizing proper body mechanics and patient safety measures

1A59CD7C736D4299A404ED467D58B375.description: Demonstrate and assist patient to dangle.

AADB4BFEB14C4FB79F1B18D73625E3C6.description: Demonstrate adjustment of bed and side-rails according to facility policy.

7CCEC42CFF1F44ACA74694AF8E5A04C8.description: Observe, report, and record changes in the patient's behavior as needed, including mental awareness.

6FBDF149B9864FB7AF89B9296A312B8D.description: Maintain service areas on the units including supplies and equipment.

2603B2D0269442229BFE1EE6C5CA3BA6.description: Maintain safe patient units, equipment, and a comfortable environment.

6DC3D8D670A8412789EC9514DCAE715E.description: Implement appropriate regulatory and accrediting agency patient safety guidelines.

99BB8CA7558440B2852F86ABD0BD447C.description: Perform physical comfort and safety functions specific to nurse assisting. The student will be able to:

0490729F7FF74B94B3F525D1ACC2F316.description:
Recognize that a C.N.A. must self-report any crimes they’ve been involved in within 30 days of the offense in accordance with
(456.0727(1)(w), F.S.).

90E14B87DED34B509FCFA793F9654F44.description: Demonstrate the understanding of vulnerable population abuse and reporting procedures per agency.

7DD3B3D6EA6B49C798244DBC68C0A903.description: Recognize and report signs of substance abuse.

D26F98F74F274321B09192383A3CACD9.description: Follow policies and procedures affecting the health, safety, and well-being of patients.

F3F7C7D4127642C690E8B77CBB76BC3F.description: Practice the proper procedures to follow regarding medical errors.

2153A2C2FC484A929B73175011229C22.description: Recognize potential for and prevention of medical errors.

BC8444A79D11487D888616DEAAF71943.description: Exhibit behavior supporting and promoting patients’ and/or residents' rights.

C1FE7943FBB44087A7CA6407C31023B4.description: Demonstrate safe standards of patient care including prevention and quality of care

2E3CDDEC7BE54ABDADD58563A6DB3299.description: Follow policies and procedures affecting the health, safety, and well-being of patients.

4EAEFC73182646418966308CF7080C8A.description: Describe the purpose of the chain of communication to resolve conflict.

FDE78D823F414046ACF57152A3539AEA.description:
Discuss and demonstrate legal and ethical behavior within the nursing assistant scope of practice including role limitations in
Florida.

A788172A4AF843E1BD2EAEF85579CE11.description: Demonstrate legal and ethical responsibilities specific to nurse assisting. The student will be able to:

E874977C082941A1831DFB2A4576DB62.description: Demonstrate use of the communication system.

CEC0C584A2654AAC82E0E2FB97CD4791.description: Utilize verbal and written information to assist with the patient's plan of care.

4B14783752A4466E9B955C2453E52BCA.description: Obtain specified data from patient and family.

FBB9A20C18C5445886086343FF8FCA4F.description: Use verbal and written communications specific to nurse assisting. The student will be able to:
